page.title: 06FARMING IN/AROUND CHAGFORD
page.content: Around Chagford there is a great number of farms which vary in size. Many isolated farmsteads are dotted on the moorland landscape and the main types of farming are{cattle and sheep. In this area soil cover is thin and not fertile enough to produce sizeable crops for arable farming. Most crops grown are for feeding animals, such as silage, hay and corn. {Dairy cattle are more widespread than{Beef cattle, while a great number of {sheep}are to be seen in the fields. In our block there is only one{Pig}farm of any size. Chagford has its own{Livestock {Market,}held monthly, and local farm_ ers also visit the{Exeter}market, held weekly. As stated elsewhere, farming accounts for the employment of a great deal of people in this area.
